newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ dollar ends lower after tight range-trade.
newsitem.headline: NZ dollar ends lower after tight range-trade.

text.p: The New Zealand dollar ended slightly lower on Monday after a quiet session stuck within a tight US$0.6887-03 range.
A holiday in Japan meant there was no talk of further Samurai bond issuance -- a key factor in last week's rally to around US$0.7030.
The Kiwi closed at US$0.6987/94 from 0.7000/07 early in the session and at 66.50 on the Trade Weighted Index from 66.60.
There was little reaction to New Zealand First Party Leader Winston Peters' comments on Sunday that an NZ First-led government would drive down interest and exchange rates.
"It just drifted off in extremely quiet trade," said one Auckland dealer.
Resistance was now seen at around 0.7025-30.

"If we can get through that 0.7020-30 level, it would be quite an impressive performance for the currency and we would get some technical and psychological support from that," he said. Expected range overnight 0.6880-05.
